intro: Cephalaria decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow to orange ray florets surrounded by tubular disk florets, typical of the genus Cephalaria. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
